ACT
155.  
Restrictions on division of estate
Division of an estate may be demanded only on the condition that all successors are known.
If successors enter into an agreement that the estate is not to be divided during a particular term, the estate shall not be divided before expiry of the agreed term. If a term is not agreed to or the term is longer than ten years, the term shall be deemed to be ten years after the date of opening of the succession.
An estate shall not be divided during the term specified by the will or succession contract unless the successors agree otherwise. If division of an estate is prohibited by the will or succession contract without specifying a term or if the term is longer than thirty years, the term shall be deemed to be thirty years after the date of opening of the succession.
